comments.text:
Just so you know... first of all congatulations on learning a new language! 
I believe learning new languages opens up people to amazing new experiences.

As for the accent thing, well... J-Lo is a puertorrican from the Bronx, so 
she is going to have an accent, although hers is not as marked as many 
other people.

Also, in the US itself you'll get many people who are caucasian speaking 
differently because different areas have different accents (New York are is 
completely different than the Southern Regions like Texas). However her I 
love you papi" was pronounced differently on purpose because it's supposed 
to sound like a slang.

Anyway, keep on learning as amny languages as you can! :-)

IT'S, LIKE, ONCE I'M ON STAGE.

BEFOREHAND, I'M LIKE THAT
TILL THE VERY SECOND,

AND THEN ONCE I'M OUT ON STAGE,

BUT IT'S GOOD THAT IT HAPPENS,
LIKE, 30 SECONDS BEFORE FOR YOU.

RIGHT BEFORE, LIKE,

JUST AS THE LIGHTS GO DOWN,

OR WE'RE DOING WHATEVER,
IT'S LIKE...
[inhales and exhales]

IT'S, LIKE,
THIS REALLY GOOD FEELING.

THAT'S THE MOST IMPORTANT
THING TOO, ESPECIALLY--

- ESPECIALLY WHEN YOU HAVE

SORRY.

RIGHT NOW?

BUT I'M ON THE BACK END OF IT.

I'M ON THE BACK END OF IT.
